metadata.title: Robinson R44
aws::graph::propositions: Ground Handling Features of the Robinson R44 Helicopter
Robinson R44 helicopters are equipped with wheel mounts toward the rear of the skids.
The wheel mounts are located one on each side of the Robinson R44.
The wheel mounts are for attachment of removable wheels.
The wheels must be removed prior to flight.
The wheel mount brackets are positioned slightly behind the helicopter's center of gravity.
When wheels are installed, the Robinson R44 sits nose low.
The wheel assembly has a pivot pin.
The pivot pin is inserted into the skid-mounted bracket.
The pivot pin is rotated over center to lift the rear of the skids about 2 inches.
When the rear skids are lifted, the front of the skids remain on the ground.
The helicopter can be moved by pulling down on the tail.
Pulling down on the tail lifts the front of the skids off the ground.
The Robinson R44 is larger than the Robinson R22.
The Robinson R44 is heavier than the Robinson R22.
The tail of the Robinson R44 is higher from the ground compared to the Robinson R22.
It is extremely difficult for a single person to move the Robinson R44 by pulling down on the tail.
It may be impossible for a single person to move the Robinson R44 by pulling down on the tail.
Another person can help move the Robinson R44 by pushing on the bracing behind the engine.

text:
## Ground handling

R44s are equipped with wheel mounts toward the rear of the skids, one on each side, for attachment of removable wheels. The wheels must be removed prior to flight. These brackets are slightly behind the helicopter center of gravity so when the wheels are installed, the helicopter sits nose low.  The wheel assembly has a pivot pin which is inserted into the skid-mounted bracket and then rotated over center to lift the rear of the skids about 2 inches leaving the front of the skids on the ground.  The helicopter can be moved by pulling down on the tail to lift the front of the skids off the ground.  Because of the size and weight of the R44 and the height of the tail from the ground, as compared to the R22, it is extremely difficult if not impossible for a single person to move the helicopter this way.  Another person can help by pushing on the bracing behind the engine.
